head.title: Community Boards: The When and the Where

hedline.hl1: Community Boards: The When and the Where

block.p: DISTRICT 1 -- Battery Park, Civic Center, Financial District, South Street Seaport, TriBeCa; third Tuesday of the month; next meeting May 16, 5:30 P.M.; P.S. 234, 292 Greenwich Street. Board chairwoman: Anne Compoccia. District manager: Paul Goldstein. (212) 442-5050. Agenda: Report on the Guggenheim Museum presentation for Piers 9, 11, 13 and 14.

DISTRICT 2 -- Greenwich Village, Little Italy, NoHo, SoHo, parts of Chinatown, West Village, Hudson Square; meetings are usually on the next to last Thursday of the month; next meeting May 18, 7 P.M.; St. Vincent's Hospital, 170 West 12th Street, at Seventh Avenue, Cronin Auditorium, 10th floor. District manager: Arthur Strickler. Board chairman: Jim Smith. (212) 979-2272. Agenda: Election of nominating committee.

District manager: Arthur Strickler. Board chairman: Jim Smith. (212) 979-2272. Agenda: Election of nominating committee.

DISTRICT 3 -- Chinatown, East Village, Lower East Side; meetings are usually on the last Tuesday of the month; next meeting May 23, 6:30 P.M.; P.S. 20, 166 Essex Street between East Houston and Stanton Streets. District manager: Martha Danziger. (212) 533-5300. Agenda: To be announced.

DISTRICT 4 -- Chelsea, Clinton; first Wednesday of the month; next meeting June 7, 6 P.M.; Hudson Guild/ Fulton Center, 119 Ninth Avenue, between 17th and 18th Streets. Acting district manager: Maggie Nachlin. Board chairwoman: Katherine Gray. (212) 736-4536. Agenda: To be announced.

DISTRICT 5 -- Central Park South, Central Business District, Theater District, Gramercy, Clinton, Union Square, Rose Hill, Little India, Rockefeller Center; second Thursday of the month; next meeting May 11 6 P.M.; Fashion Institute of Technology, Building A. on 27th Street and Eighth Avenue (eighth floor). District manager: Kathy Kinsella. Board chairwoman: Lola Finkelstein. (212) 465-0907. Agenda: Rezoning of Central Park South sites, sidewalk cafe and newsstand applications, park permits.

DISTRICT 6 -- Murray Hill, Turtle Bay, Stuyvesant Square, Gramercy Park, Peter Cooper Village, Beekman, Sutton; second Wednesday of the month; next meeting this Wednesday, 7 P.M.; New York University Medical Center, Classroom A, 550 First Avenue at 30th Street. District manager: Carol Pieper. Board chairman: Martin J. Barrett. (212) 679-0907. Agenda: To be announced.

DISTRICT 7 -- Upper West Side; first Tuesday of the month; next meeting Tuesday, June 6, 7 P.M.; Fordham University, 113 West 60th Street. District manager: Penny Ryan. Board chairman: Eric Nelson. (212) 362-4008. Agenda: To be announced.

DISTRICT 8 -- Upper East Side, Roosevelt Island; third Wednesday of the month; next meeting May 17, 7 P.M.; New York Blood Center, 310 East 67th Street. District manager: Victoria Caramante. Board chairman: M. Barry Schneider. (212) 758-4340. Agenda: Public hearing on the Citywide Statement of Needs for City Facilities for fiscal years 2001 and 2002.

DISTRICT 9 -- Morningside Heights, Manhattanville, Hamilton Heights; third Thursday of the month; next meeting May 18, 6:30 P.M.; board office, 565 West 125th Street, between Broadway and Old Broadway. District manager: Lawrence McClean. Board chairman: George Goodwill. (212) 864-6200. Agenda: To be announced.

DISTRICT 10 -- Central Harlem; first Wednesday of the month; next meeting June 7, 6 P.M.; Adam Clayton Powell State Office Building, 163 West 125th Street, second-floor art gallery. District manager: Richard Harley. Assistant district manager: Mark Bones. Board chairman: Stanley Gleaton. (212) 749-3105. Agenda: To be announced.

DISTRICT 11 -- East Harlem; third Tuesday of the month; next meeting May 16, 6:30 P.M.; La Guardia Memorial House, 307 East 116th Street. District manager: J. D. Irizarry. Board chairman: David Givens. (212) 831-8929. Agenda: To be announced.

DISTRICT 12 -- Washington Heights and Inwood; fourth Tuesday of the month; next meeting May 23, 7 P.M.; Good Shepherd Church, 620 Isham Street (between Cooper Street and Seaman Avenue). Board chairman: William Garcia. (212) 568-8500. Agenda: To be announced.
